subtitleNullable: Personal project to play with Nashville’s Car Crash Dataset.
descriptionNullable:
# Nashville Crash Data 2015-2021

Data Obtained From:  https://data.nashville.gov/Police/Traffic-Accidents/6v6w-hpcw

## Business Task

Personal project to play with Nashville’s Car Crash Dataset. To find out geographically within Nashville & surrounding areas:

Where accidents happen the most?
How many fatalities?
How many were injured?
What Collision type occurs more often?
Does Daytime & or Nighttime affect accidents?

For now I decided to work with BigQuery to run some queries to count the Collision type Accidents in different parts of the car.


SELECT COUNT (*) FROM `crash-347000.carcrash.trafficAccidents`
WHERE  Collision_Type_Description = 'ANGLE'; =51385
 
SELECT DISTINCT Collision_Type_Description FROM `crash-347000.carcrash.trafficAccidents` ;
 
So now I repeatedly ran queries to count how many of each different type of collision there had been for each.
 
2
ANGLE =51385
3
OTHER=2490
4
HEAD-ON = 4570
5
UNKNOWN=2786
6
REAR-TO-REAR=1112
7
Rear to Side=1531
8
Front to Rear=77898
9
SIDESWIPE - SAME DIRECTION=31032
10
SIDESWIPE - OPPOSITE DIRECTION=4693
11
NOT COLLISION W/MOTOR VEHICLE-TRANSPORT=37088

 
##Discovery #1

The Highest Vehicle Collision Location was Front to Rear and the Lowest was Rear to Rear.

Next Query was to find out the COUNT where Hit & Run = False and True

SELECT COUNT (*) FROM `crash-347000.carcrash.trafficAccidents`
WHERE Hit_and_Run= true; 48003 |  false; 166581
 
Also ran a query to see how many accidents happened during daylight:

SELECT Date_and_Time, Weather_Description,Illumination_Description
FROM `crash-347000.carcrash.trafficAccidents`
WHERE Illumination_Code = 1;  146612
 
Next Query for anything other than DAYLIGHT:
 
 SELECT Date_and_Time, Weather_Description,Illumination_Description
FROM `crash-347000.carcrash.trafficAccidents`
WHERE Illumination_Description NOT LIKE "DAYLIGHT"; 67700
&
FOG=450

##Discovery #2

Although most accidents happen in Daylight, I hypothesize it’s because there are more cars on the road, due to work traffic.

Also ran an aggregate query to see what addresses in the Nashville area had the most accidents.
 
SELECT Street_Address, COUNT (*)
FROM `crash-347000.carcrash.trafficAccidents`
GROUP BY Street_Address
ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC ;


##Discovery #3 (SEE PNG ATTATCHMENTS)
We can clearly see that most accidents occurred on;
1) I-40 E EXIT RAMP & I-40
2) I-40 W EXIT RAMP & I-40
3) I-24 W EXIT RAMP & I-24
 
SUM of Fatalities 2015-2021 =214601 

As I continued working on my data , I started to Visualize some data on Tableau and please look below for a couple of data Viz’s.
title: Nashville Vehicle Collision Dataset
subtitle: Personal project to play with Nashville’s Car Crash Dataset.
